head.title: World Briefing | Middle East: Hamas Criticizes U.S. Security Aid For Abbas

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Middle East: Hamas Criticizes U.S. Security Aid For Abbas

abstract.p: Hamas criticizes $59 million American aid package authorized to bolster Palestinian security measures because most of money is being used to support Fatah forces of Palestinian Pres Mahmoud Abbas; Hamas says all money should be channeled through Palestinian treasury (S)

block.p: Hamas, the militant group now in a fragile unity government with the rival Fatah faction, criticized a $59 million American aid package authorized earlier this week to bolster Palestinian security measures as ''dirty'' and ''ill intentioned'' because most of the money is to be used to support the Fatah forces of the Palestinian president, Mahmoud Abbas. Hamas said all the money should be channeled through the Palestinian treasury. In Brussels, the Palestinian finance minister, Salam Fayyad, asked the European Union for $1.3 billion to avert an ''acute financial crisis'' this year. The European Union deals with Mr. Fayyad, an internationally respected independent member of the unity government, but boycotts Hamas, which it defines as a terrorist organization. The Union, which suspended direct aid to the Palestinian Authority when Hamas came to power a year ago, said it would not be resumed at this stage.
